events.name: How To Start A Startup
events.description: Curious about startups? Have an idea for a new venture? Already working on one, but need help and/or funding? Learn how NYU helps founders become the next generation of startup leaders. Meet members of the Entrepreneurial Institute team, & learn how to start a startup at NYU, & all the programming, events, resources & funding opportunities that exist to support & accelerate NYU entrepreneurs. This session will be led by Frank Rimalovski , Executive Director of the NYU Entrepreneurial Institute. Frank heads the Entrepreneurial Institute, coaches NYU startups, & is the Managing Director of the NYU Innovation Venture Fund, which invests in early stage NYU startups. He is a member of the national teaching team for the National Science Foundation's I-Corps program & an adjunct faculty at the NYU Tandon School of Engineering. Frank has been a venture capitalist for over 23 years. When: March 5 (12:00 - 1:00 pm) Where: Leslie Lab, 16 Washington Place The NYU Entrepreneurial Institute provides reasonable accommodations to people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations for events & services should be submitted at least two weeks before the date of the accommodation need. Please email entrepreneur@nyu.edu for assistance.

events.name: Sternberg Lecture w/ OpenAI
events.description: Please note that there will be a livestream option for this in-person event. If you register to attend virtually, you will receive the link to view it on the morning of the event. Anna Makanju is OpenAI's Vice President of Global Impact. She previously worked on technology regulation at Facebook & SpaceX & taught at Princeton. Anna spent eight years in the Obama/Biden administration, where she served as a senior policy advisor to the Vice President, as a director on the NSC, & in a number of senior roles at the Department of State & the Pentagon. She received her law degree from Stanford, & has worked at international criminal tribunals in the Hague, on the Third Circuit Court of Appeals, & in the international arbitration group of Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton LLP. Anna also serves on the boards of Coty, Panera Brands, & the Freeman Spogli Institute for International Studies at Stanford.

events.name: Climate Happy Hour - What Are You Fighting For?
events.description: Calling all climate champions! Are you a grad student, researcher, post-doc, admin or startup founder passionate about saving our planet? The NYU Climate Community invites you to our new monthly happy hour where innovation meets impact.  Network with fellow eco-warriors Discover groundbreaking research Explore exciting career opportunities Connect with cutting-edge climate startups Fuel your passion (and your appetite) with complimentary drinks & snacks while you mingle with NYU's brightest minds in climate solutions. Whether you're developing new technologies, researching breakthrough strategies, or launching the next big green idea, this is your chance to collaborate, inspire, & be inspired.  Every First Wednesday of the Month 5:30 PM - 7:30 PM NYU Entrepreneurial Institute Join us & answer the question: What are YOU fighting for?

events.name: LeadDev Meetup
events.description: Get ready for the launch of LeadDev New York Meetups!  Can't wait until the fall to get your LeadDev New York fix? No need to worry - quarterly LeadDev Meetups are coming to New York! Join us for the special launch event on Wednesday, March 5 & enjoy an evening of networking & talks on building effective engineering culture & growing leaders. Drinks & nibbles will be provided on the night, thanks to Datadog! Date: Wednesday, March 5, 2025Time: 5:30 - 9 pmLocation: New York Times Building, 620 8th Ave, New York, NY 10018 Spaces are limited - you must RSVP to attend. Attendees must also bring a government-issued ID with a name that matches their Meetup registration to enter the New York Times Building. We hope to see you there! Schedule:5.30 pm - 6:30 pm: Arrival, networking & refreshments6.20 pm - Welcome from host - Jessica Simon (Senior Engineering Manager, Airbnb)6:30 pm - Growing Managers Through Shifts in Context & Scale - David Mitchell (Senior Vice President, Engineering, Datadog) & Claudia D'Adamo (Senior Engineering Manager, Cloud Observability, Datadog)6:50 pm - Closing the Skills Gap: Our Competency-Based Learning Journey - Max Chadwick (Senior Solutions Architect, Rightpoint)7:05 pm - Break7:30 pm - The AI-powered Morning Ritual: Your Daily Briefing Reimagined - Gordon Diggs (Engineering Manager, Connect Platform Experiences, Stripe)8.00 pm - 9:00 pm - Networking through to close You can also join our Slack workspace to keep up to date with everything in our New York community. Join the channel #leaddev-nyc or #new-york. If you need further information or have any questions, please send an email to: hello@leaddev.com. Here is a friendly reminder of our Code of Conduct to help protect the safety of our community. Don't forget to share this with your colleagues who may be interested, & keep an eye out for upcoming meetups later this year! And a big thank you to our New York meetup partner Datadog!

events.name: Mindstone AI Meetup
events.description: ***Please Note: This event is advertised on multiple platforms. Please RSVP & get a ticket on Mindstone to view the agenda & guarantee a spot.*** Welcome to the most electrifying & ground-breaking AI Meetup in New York City! Join us once a month as we delve into the world of artificial intelligence, explore its cutting-edge practical applications, & marvel at the astonishing projects that are shaping our future. Why should you attend? Get up close & personal with the AI projects that are redefining the boundaries of technology & human potential.Learn from the brightest minds in the field & gain valuable insights into the ever-evolving AI landscape.Unleash your curiosity, fuel your creativity, & expand your network as you connect with fellow AI aficionados & pioneers.What you can expect?Mindstone events consist of three talks covering different aspects: What I Learned Building With LLMs: A technical demo breaking down the process for building a product using AI with real-life learnings & insights.How To Be More Productive Using AI: A practical demo & step-by-step guide on how to use AI to speed up & improve tasks.What Does The Future Look Like With AI?: A theoretical talk on the impact of AI on work, life & society.After the talks we'll have pizza, drinks, & networking. Don't miss out on this extraordinary opportunity to witness the AI revolution in action. It's time to embark on a thrilling journey into the future & discover the endless possibilities that lie within the realm of artificial intelligence. Reserve your spot today for the ultimate AI experience!  ***Please Note: This event is advertised on multiple platforms. Please RSVP & get a ticket on Mindstone to view the agenda & guarantee a spot.***

events.name: Startup Pitch Mixer
events.description: Agenda6:00 PM - 6:30 PM Registration Trent Guests register, receive badges, & event programs. This is an opportunity for casual networking, making first connections, & preparing for the event.6:30 PM - 7:30 PM Event Kickoff & Interactive Networking Official welcome from the organizers with a brief overview of the event goals & schedule. Interactive networking helps participants set their objectives & connect with key contacts.7:40 PM - 8:20 PM Startup Pitch Session Startups present their projects to investors & experts. Each team has 5 minutes to pitch, covering the project's core idea, business model, & target market.8:20 PM - 9:00 PM Chill & Networking Participants enjoy casual conversations with investors, discuss collaborations, & exchange ideas over refreshments. Hi there! Dear Participants! Join our event in New York!Meet & get acquainted with Startup Founders, Business Professionals & Investors. Pitch to the audience with your project & seize your chance to dive into the world of business, technology, & venture capital.  Why You Can't-Miss It:Engage with leading experts & founders in the Tech & Business, & top investors to gain deep insights & valuable networking. This event is a must-attend for those looking to gain ideas, experience, & valuable connections.  Present Your Startup in the Tech & Business:Showcase your startup in the Tech & Business! events.name: 1000 Dreams Fund - Building The Future w/ AI & Web3
events.description: Please Join 1,000 Dreams Fund for Building the Future Web3 & AI Workforce powered by Ripple! For Women's History Month, the 1,000 Dreams Fund is teaming up with Ripple to host an exclusive gathering at the Ripple headquarters in NYC to showcase & connect women in blockchain & AI around the focus of workforce development. As the Web3 & AI markets moon, how are tech leaders building talent pipelines to keep pace with industry innovation & growth? How do we pave the way to ensure high potential women have access to those career opportunities? Through this unique invite-only gathering, 1DF's Future Fund Fellowship aims to empower future leaders & foster authentic connections across this burgeoning ecosystem to shape the tomorrow's workforce. This event is FREE but registration is required & limited. Please RSVP by Wednesday, February 26, 2025. For all other questions & inquiries please contact us at kelsey@1000dreamsfund.org

events.name: Reinventing The Heartland
events.description: P&T Knitwear is pleased to welcome Nicholas Lalla for a discussion of his newest book, Reinventing the Heartland: an account of Lalla's experience with Tulsa Innovation Labs to help Tulsa, OK, transition from its oil & gas legacy to tech - & a bold & pragmatic plan for urban reinvention. Along with a conversation & audience Q&A, Nicholas will also sign copies of Reinventing the Heartland.   RESERVE YOUR SIGNED COPY OF REINVENTING THE HEARTLAND: HOW ONE CITY'S INCLUSIVE APPROACH TO INNOVATION AND GROWTH CAN REVIVE THE AMERICAN DREAMAVAILABLE TO SHIP MOST PLACES This is a ticketed in-store event with limited amphitheater-style seating. Doors open at 6:30pm.Cost of a $5 general admission ticket can be applied towards your purchase of the featured event book or any product in our caf the night of an event.Cost of a book bundle ticket reflects the total cost of the feature event book (MSRP plus tax). Each book bundle ticket guarantees ticket holders one (1) copy of the feature event book.The talk will be followed by a book signing. Books signed at P&T Knitwear events must be purchased from P&T Knitwear. If you would like a signed copy & cannot attend the event, we're happy to take your pre-order. We ship most places!We encourage all guests to wear masks. ABOUT THE AUTHORNicholas Lalla is an urbanist & social entrepreneur, working at the intersection of economic development & emerging technology. He partners with cities to build strategies & initiatives that catalyze inclusive growth. Lalla founded Tulsa Innovation Labs, an organization deploying over $200 million to build northeast Oklahoma's innovation economy. He previously led Cyber NYC for the New York City Economic Development Corporation, a cybersecurity initiative The New York Times called "among the nation's most ambitious . . . " Earlier in his career, at the Urban Land Institute, he launched a national resilience program for cities combatting the effects of climate change. Lalla has written for Newsweek, Fast Company, Stanford Social Innovation Review, & Next City, among other outlets

events.name: Wellness Morning For Women Founders
events.description: Join us for a morning of Mindfulness & Wellness Workshops for Female FoundersStart your day with intention, inspiration, & community at our Wellness Morning for Female Founders! Women are demanding better, smarter, & more proactive ways to support their bodies & hormonal health. Instead of treating one-off symptoms, DailyBasis is helping shift the conversation toward nourishing the body from within, so women can experience more balance, fewer symptoms, & a healthier cycle overall. Start your day with light yoga, & stay for healthy breakfast + wellness breakouts led by experts across the health spectrum. Hear from the founders of DailyBasis on how they're building in the women's health & nutrition space. What to expect: 8:30-9:15am: light vinyasa yoga stretch 9:15-9:45am: breakfast & tea (from UsTwo) & Q&A with DailyBasis founders 9:45-10:30am: breakouts with our wellness experts Izzy Fischer & Sophie Allen - Co-Founders, DailyBasis United by their personal health journeys as lifelong athletes & professional experiences at high-growth startups & established corporations like Clif Bar, Izzy & Sophie founded DailyBasis to close the gap in accessible, science-backed nutrition for women. Their mission is to empower women with the knowledge & tools they need to work with their bodies-not against them-so they can feel informed, supported, & in control of their health. Follow DailyBasis on instagram.  User Uploaded ImageOur wellness breakout leaders: Hormonal health & exercise: Allison Yamamoto is the founder of Ally which helps women ditch diets & exercises that are burning them out in order to get a regular period & feel their most empowered & energized in their health.  User Uploaded ImageGut health & nutrition: Ashley Osborne is the founder of Biome Elite, a wellness company dedicated to optimizing gut health through advanced microbiome testing, lifestyle analysis, & personalized plans with targeted supplements & expert coaching  User Uploaded ImageMental health & life coaching: Marianna Cuomo Maier, a National Board-Certified Health & Wellness Coach & the founder of Grata Wellness, empowers individuals through coaching, corporate programs, & workshops to prevent burnout & sustain well-being.  User Uploaded ImageShanti House Shanti House is a conscious-living + wellness community for innovators. Focused in NYC, we partner with mission-driven brands to create curated events for like-minded people to recover, discover, & connect. Want to learn more? events.name: Drones & Robotics AI Summit
events.description: Join Us at the Drones, Robotics & AI Summit 2025 - March 6th!  The premier gathering for innovators, investors, & thought leaders in autonomous systems is back! The Drones, Robotics & AI Summit 2025 brings together founders, academics, fund managers, & strategic partners at the forefront of next-generation automation. Past summits have welcomed Henrik Christensen (author of the Congressional Robotics Roadmap), Matt Fraser (NYC CTO), Wendy Ju (Cornell Tech), Star Ginn (NASA), FDNY Robotics, NYPD Drone Units, Manna Drones & Delivery, Cambrian Robotics, Plus One Robotics, Genius NY, & many more trailblazing startups, thought leaders, & government officials. This year, expect cutting-edge insights, hands-on demonstrations, & unparalleled networking opportunities with 300+ industry leaders shaping the future of robotics & AI. Don't miss your chance to be part of the conversation driving innovation forward. Program organized by Oliver Mitchell of ff Venture Capital. Confirmed speakers :Ryan Gariepy, Clearpath Robotics / Rockwell AutomationStella Yoo, EvercoreAndrea Thomasz, Diligent RoboticsAbe Murray, AlleyCorpSean Simpson, NewlabRet. events.name: Americas Information War Comes Home
events.description: Former Under Secretary of State & Time magazine editor Richard Stengel will join moderator Kanika Mehra for a timely discussion on the evolution of digital disinformation & its impact on global democracy. The event, hosted at Mintz's New York office, will explore themes from Stengel's acclaimed book "Information Wars" through the lens of current events, including the 2024 election cycle & emerging AI-driven challenges to information integrity. Drawing from his unique experience as the Obama administration's disinformation czar, Stengel will discuss how the tactics he observed from state & non-state actors have evolved in today's rapidly changing information landscape. The conversation will examine how disinformation strategies first deployed by ISIS & refined by Russia have been adapted & amplified through new technologies & platforms. "The information battlefield has only become more complex since I first wrote 'Information Wars,'" says Stengel. "Understanding these patterns is crucial as we navigate unprecedented challenges to truth in the digital age."

events.name: Climatetech Innovation Across Markets - Global Incubator Program
events.description: Join us for an exciting evening as we celebrate the culmination of Year 5 of the Innovate UK Global Incubator Programme led by the Urban Future Lab (UFL) at the NYU Tandon School of Engineering, Greentown Labs, & Innovate UK.  This event brings together groundbreaking startups, industry leaders, & experts to explore the intersection of technology, sustainability, & global market expansion. Whether you're an investor, entrepreneur, or climate enthusiast, this is the perfect opportunity to discover the future of climate solutions & learn from those who are shaping it. What to expect: Each of our startups will host a small table displaying their innovative technology or product, providing an intimate, hands-on experience. Enjoy one-on-one conversations with the founders & team members behind these groundbreaking startups in a relaxed, low-pressure environment.  Keynote Address by Bethany Davis Noll (Executive Director of State Energy & Environmental Impact Center at NYU School of Law). Bethany will share insights on the intersection of state-level policy, energy, & environmental impact given the implications of the current administration on the regulatory landscape.  Take part in our Climate Tech Passport challenge. As you visit each startup table, collect stamps on your passport. Complete the passport & earn a special prize!   Fireside Chat 1: Entering New Markets moderated by Rory Sisco, Founder & CEO, Quint Strategy Moving into the US market is no small feat. It involves navigating a maze of regulations, incentives, & state-by-state differences. This discussion will give us a chance to hear directly from startups about their experiences, from the surprises they encountered in their first pilot projects to the lessons they've learned about choosing the right place to start. Fireside Chat 2: Customer Discovery Process & Insights moderated by Anne-Sophie Mahle, Director of International Partnerships, New York City Economic Development Corporation Customer discovery can look very different in the US compared to other markets. In this discussion, founders will share what they've learned about engaging with customers here, how they've adapted their strategies, & what insights from their industries are helping them shape their next steps.  Light drinks & appetizers will be served, creating the perfect atmosphere for connection & discovery. Meet our startups & learn more about their journey here: Camfridge's solid-state cooling technology cuts carbon & reduces the cost of refrigeration for commercial users. Kensa is the UK's market leader in ground-source heat pumps, their 'Networked Heat Pumps' approach offers the cheapest, lowest carbon heating & cooling available, at the lowest energy system impact. Olsights is a clean energy data visualization & app developer creating visually interactive digital tools that enable developers & permitting authorities to quickly screen for viable development opportunities in Hydrogen, Carbon Capture Utilisation & Storage, & their connection to the grid.   ReVentas has developed a novel dissolution recycling process for waste plastic, able to remove all pigments & additives from post-consumer Polyethylene & Polypropylene, the two most common plastics in use, & produce a high-quality virgin-like replacement.  Trust Electric Heating, founded in 2017, manufactures & installs award-winning, patented, & smart heating technologies that embody the pinnacle of British innovation. Their products are designed to offer optimal energy efficiency, providing significant savings on heating bills & enhancing comfort for end users.

events.name: Site Reliability Engg Tech Talks
events.description: Google SRE NYC proudly announces our next event in the Google SRE NYC Tech Talk series. The event will take place on Thursday, 6th of March 2025 at 6 PM at our Chelsea Markets office in NYC. The doors will open at 5:30 pm. Pls RSVP only if you're able to attend in-person, there will be no live streaming. Join us for an hour of interactive short talks on Site Reliability & DevOps topics with an opportunity to mingle with the speakers & attendees over some light snacks & beverages. When RSVP'ing to this event, please enter your full name exactly as it appears on your government issued ID. You will be required to present your ID at check in. Agenda: Michal Wegorek - Staff Software & Site Reliability Engineer at Google, BigtableCanary Analysis. De-Risking Deployments, the SRE WayHow Google SREs use Canary Analysis to help ensure safe deployments for one of the largest No-SQL databases on the planet with 5 9's reliability SLA with no maintenance downtimeMichal is a Staff Software & Site Reliability Engineer at Google, specializing in the intricate world of distributed systems, particularly those at extreme scale. He's part of the Bigtable team. The Bigtable database handles over 10 Exabytes of data, sustains 7 billion queries per second, & maintains an impressive five nines of reliability. As a technical lead, he guides his team through complex design challenges, ensuring robust & scalable solutions. Though he now primarily focuses on architectural design & reviews, his passion for coding remains as strong as ever. Michal is energized by the collaborative spirit of his colleagues, valuing the diverse perspectives that contribute to their collective success. Outside of work, Michal channels his energy into tennis, striving for daily workouts to maintain both physical & mental agility. He believes in the power of teamwork, both on & off the court. He's always eager to connect with fellow engineers & discuss the advancements in distributed systems. Michael Josi - Senior Director Software Engineering - Head SRE at TransamericaSRE Psychology: Understanding the Human Element in System Reliability"What if you have a beautiful SLO Dashboard & it's all red & no one cares?"The mission of Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is to ensure the reliability, scalability, & performance of critical systems - a goal best achieved through strong collaboration with teams across the organization. We are exploring how SRE is embedded in an organization, how it interfaces with application owners, senior management, business stakeholders & external software/hardware vendors. In all these cases the success of SRE's mission hinges on the effectiveness of the relationships. We will use plenty of examples of what worked, what failed in our past work & why. Additionally, we will address funding challenges that can unexpectedly impact even well-established SRE teams. Mike has built his career around driving performance & efficiency, specializing in optimizing the security, availability & speed of cloud applications, data & infrastructure. He developed the first currency program trading system for the Toronto Stock Exchange at UBS & later refined his expertise in optimizing trading systems & migrating core data to the cloud at Morgan Stanley & Transamerica. He is a founding member of the NYZH consultancy, focusing on AI & SRE. Based in Denver, Colorado, Mike is a pilot who enjoys desert racing & cycling, sharing adventures with his wife & three children. Vishakha Sadhawani - Cloud Architect at GoogleCloud & DevOps, connection with SRE Principles & PracticesGet ready to dive into the world of DevOps & Cloud tech!This session will help you navigate the complex world of Cloud & DevOps with confidence. This session is ideal for new grads, career changers, & anyone feeling overwhelmed by the buzz around DevOps. We'll break down its core concepts, demystify the jargon, & explore how DevOps is essential for success in the ever-changing technology landscape, particularly in the emerging era of generative AI. A basic understanding of software development concepts is helpful, but enthusiasm to learn is most important.Vishakha is a Senior Cloud Architect at Google Cloud Platform with over 8 years of DevOps & Cloud experience. Prior to Google, she was a DevOps engineer at AWS & a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the IaC offering CloudFormation in the NorthAm region.She has experience in diverse domains including Financial Services, Retail, & Online Media. She primarily focuses on Infrastructure Architecture, Design & Automation (IaC), Public Cloud (AWS, GCP), Kubernetes/CNCF tools, Infrastructure Security & Compliance, CI/CD & GitOps, & MLOPS.Vishakha's tech journey has taught her the value of overcoming challenges & how to thrive in tech; She's keen to connect with fellow DevOps Enthusiasts & SREs to share her experiences & provide support. Our Tech Talks series are focused on professional development & networking: no recruiters, sales or press are allowed. Google is committed to providing a harassment-free & inclusive conference experience for everyone, & all participants must follow our Event Community Guidelines. The event will be photographed & video recorded.Event space is limited! A reservation is required to attend. Reserve your spot today & share the event details with your SRE/DevOps friends

events.name: Friends Of Koop Happy Hour
events.description: Join fellow Founders, Builders, & Investors for an evening of great conversation, networking, & friendly competition over fancy cocktails!nThis casual meetup is the perfect opportunity to connect, exchange ideas, & build meaningful relationships in a relaxed setting.nPlus, dont miss our special giveaway at Unlisted in Lower Manhattan!nWe look forward to seeing you there!nHow the Giveaway WorksnAll event attendees will be eligible for a 20% discount on one year of SOC 2 certification!nThe discount will be redeemable through an event-specific code well share by email & must be used within 90 days of this event (so in this case, by June 4 2025).nThats it!nWell also be sharing details about Housekeeper, our recently-launched AI Agent for compliance & insurance.nAbout KoopnKoops trust management platform helps startups navigate the complexities of regulatory compliance, security reviews, & liability insurance in a single place.nFounders & operators have to go through stringent procurement before they can land a deal with enterprise or government customers. Growing compliance standards, never-ending security reviews, & high-limit insurance requirements can derail budgets & timelines even for the most ambitious projects.nKoop liberates startups from the procurement burden by combining compliance, security, & insurance in a single platform! events.name: [Book Launch] World Eaters
events.description: The modern tech-driven economy is not working for most of us- what can we do about it? If we are going to solve the challenges that the tech industry has created, we need to address its problems at its root. TechEquity's research found that venture capital is impacting the health of our economy by exacerbating the housing crisis, exploiting workers, & suppressing innovation in the areas where we need it most. In order to sufficiently address tech's inequities, simply put: we need to follow the money. Join us on Thursday, March 6th for the launch of Catherine Bracy's new book World Eaters: an examination of venture capital, how it drives growth above wellbeing, & how we can change this model for sustainable, responsible growth. We'll hear remarks from the author herself as well as Felicia Wong, Principal, Roosevelt Institute, & Janet Haven, Executive Director, Data & Society Research Institute. Drinks & light snacks will be provided.   Event ScheduleDoors open: 6:00 pmFireside Chat: 6:30-7:00 pmPanel Discussion: 7:00 - 7:45 pmReception/Book Signing: 7:45-9:00 pm  About World EatersAn urgent & illuminating perspective that offers a window into how the most pernicious aspects of the venture capital ethos is reaching all areas of our lives, into everything from healthcare to food to entertainment to the labor market & leaving a trail of destruction in its wake. The venture capital playbook is causing unique harms to society. And in World Eaters, Catherine Bracy offers a window into the pernicious aspects of VC & shows us how its bad practices are bleeding into all industries, undermining the labor & housing markets & posing unique dangers to the economy at large. VC's creates a wide, powerful wake that impacts the average consumer just as much as it does investors & entrepreneurs. In researching this book, Bracy has interviewed founders, fund managers, contract & temp workers in the gig economy, & Limited Partners across the landscape. She learned that the current VC model is not a good fit for the majority of start-ups, & yet, there are too few options for early stage funding outside of VC dollars. And while there are some alternative paths for sustainable, responsible growth, without the help of regulators, there is not much motivation to drive investors from the roulette table that is venture capital. World Eaters is an eye-opening account of the ways that the values of contemporary venture capital hurt founders, consumers, & the market. Bracy's clear-eyed debut is a must-read for fans of Winners Take All, Super Pumped, & Brotopia, an appealing insider / outsider perspective on Silicon Valley, & those who are fascinated to look under the hood & learn why the modern economy is not working for most of us. ---------------- We enforce a Code of Conduct at our events. Please take a minute & read it through. We charge for our events in order to cover the costs associated with hosting. If the ticket fee is prohibitive, please send us a note (keirstan@techequity.us) & we're happy to share a comp code good for a free ticket.

events.name: How Bitcoin Brings About Social Change
events.description: HRF x PubKey #FreedomTech Series presents:How Bitcoin Brings About Social Change with Jason Maier Each month, the Human Rights Foundation & PubKey dive into specific HRF initiatives with a focus on how #Bitcoin & #FreedomTech advance humanitarian goals. We're thrilled to partner with HRF to shine a light on how Bitcoin is a powerful force for peace & human flourishing. Our next event will take place on Thursday, March 6th at 6pm with Jason Maier, author of A Progressive's Case for Bitcoin. Among topics discussed will be how Bitcoin addresses inflation & wealth inequality, how it compares to the current financial system's effect on the world abroad & at home, & how it's being used as a tool for human rights & financial freedom. Jason will discuss his research & advocacy in a fireside chat with HRF Research Associate Zac Guignard with audience Q&A to follow. This event is FREE & open to the public.  Join us starting at 4:30 on PubKey Spaces on X before the main event.

events.name: Women Designing The Future - Looking Back Moving Forward
events.description: Women Designing the Future: Looking Back Moving Forward Murray Center's 30th anniversary Women Designing the Future Conference arrives at a crucial inflection point in the history of technology-a time of excitement & anxiety in equal measure. To mark the occasion, we've invited experts in a variety of fields to help us track what has changed over the last three decades--and then to give us their vision of what the world will look like 30 years from now. Speakers include data scientists & AI pioneers; ecologists & environmental policymakers; high-tech entrepreneurs-and a computer scientist who uses code to make Pixar animations come alive!

events.name: Super Diners Club
events.description: Looking to build meaningful connections in an exciting, easy-going setting? Our Supermomos Curated Dinner is more than just a night out - we are launching an exclusive invitation to join our Super Diners Club, a members-only experience that connects curious & open-minded people like you for dinners twice a month, right here in NYC! Personalized curation process: To make the experience uniquely yours, you will only be accepted into the program if we believe we have the right kinds of members who are a good fit for your dining table! Our March dinner dates will be Mar 7, Friday, & Mar 25, Tuesday, & here's what to expect! Themed dinners: Each dinner date in March will be based off a selected cuisine. Kicking off this themed cuisine series with Thai food this Mar 7!  Small, intimate group: Dinners are hosted in groups of 6 members so that each connection feels natural & personal Tailored introductions: Our team thoughtfully groups you with people aligned to your interests, whether you're here to make friends, broaden your professional network, or simply expand your social horizons Fun conversation prompts: We will have a few interesting questions for you to go through together. Additionally, we might group you into different houses as well before the dinner  Surprise venue: Each dinner is hosted at a surprise restaurant that you'll discover just 1-3 days before the event If you're ready to turn these monthly dinners into a long-term experience with new friends & unexpected connections, this club was made for you.

events.name: Faith Tech Meetup
events.description: Join us at 51st & Park! Doors open 6pm, event is from 6:15pm to 7:15pm, & food & fellowship follow at Lexington Market (51st & Lex)! FaithTech is happening in New York City! Join us in person at our new location: St. Bart's (325 Park Avenue between 50th/51st) 6pm: Doors Open 6:15pm-7:15pm: Join us with our special guest, Patrick Farrell of Potomac Angel Capital/Keystone Collective(Potomac Angel Capital) 7:15pm-: All are welcome to continue with food & fellowship at Lexington Market (Lexington Avenue at 51st Street). Each person pays their own way. About FaithTech Are you a Christian who works in tech? Passionate to see technology leveraged for the Kingdom of God? Hungry to learn what it means to be redemptive & to build technology redemptively? Come meet, learn, & build with other like-minded Christians in tech as we steward our skills for the glory of God together right here in New York! Come & be a part of this tech community for Christ. - --- What is FaithTech? We are a global tech community for Christ. We exist to help people in the tech ecosystem find community & steward their skills to glorify God. Visit our website for more! What happens at a FaithTech Event? Meet: Community begins when we connect, get to know each other & build meaningful relationships. Learn: Each time we meet together, someone will speak to us on the intersection of faith & technology. Build: We start & continue community labs projects as a part of our regular meet-up rhythm. Have questions? Email us at new-york@faithtech.com * Photographs & videos may be taken during this event. Please contact us in advance if you would not like to be a part of videos & photos. Otherwise, by attending, you are agreeing to participate in our media. ** Registrants' names & registrants' emails will be added to the FaithTech NYC email list. Please let us know if you do not want your name or email shared.

We exist to help people in the tech ecosystem find community & steward their skills to glorify God. Visit our website for more! What happens at a FaithTech Event? Meet: Community begins when we connect, get to know each other & build meaningful relationships. Learn: Each time we meet together, someone will speak to us on the intersection of faith & technology. Build: We start & continue community labs projects as a part of our regular meet-up rhythm. Have questions? Email us at new-york@faithtech.com * Photographs & videos may be taken during this event. Please contact us in advance if you would not like to be a part of videos & photos. Otherwise, by attending, you are agreeing to participate in our media. ** Registrants' names & registrants' emails will be added to the FaithTech NYC email list. Please let us know if you do not want your name or email shared.

events.name: Choosing Between Open & Closed Source Data Products
events.description: DetailsRSVP Required. This will also be live streamed. ## Speakers Greg Dostatni, DBA @ Command PromptKevin Jernigan, Product Manager @ Google Cloud## Abstract When choosing between Open Source Software (OSS) & Closed Source Software (CSS), organizations must consider factors like support, customization, security, compliance & long term cost. OSS provides flexibility & cost advantages, but may require internal expertise for maintenance & development or creative problem solving when navigating non-traditional support structures. CSS offers traditional vendor support & stability of a defined roadmap, but often comes with higher costs & vendor lock-in risks. Ultimately, which choice is right for your organization depends on your resources, needs, & priorities.

events.name: AI Agents For Work
events.description: NYC Agents Workshop: Agents at Work Agentic automation has the potential to transform organizations by automating internal processes, expanding services to the long tail, & navigating bureaucracy. At the same time, they also present massive risks in terms of introducing data errors, poor reliability & LLM hallucination, the lack of accountability, data exfiltration, & spiraling resource costs. Ultimately, the use of agents for work involves issues across technology, operations, management, & more, including: Are AI agents best framed as tools or as workers? How do we manage agents & can they manage us?How do agents as a service change the customer relationship?How can we develop applications, agents, interfaces, & systems that provide sufficient accountability, reliability, & efficiency to be trusted within organizations?The Data, Agents, & Processes Lab at Columbia University is organizing a one-day workshop to bring together industry leaders, Columbia faculty & students, & technologists who are interested in the concept of AI agents. Speakers & panelists come from enterprises that are deploying agentic solutions, technologists & infrastructure leaders, & researchers at leading AI labs as well as Columbia. These include Jason Wei from OpenAI who led their chain-of-thought & agentic work, Edo Liberty who is CEO of Pinecone, Cong Yu who leads AI at Celonis, & more. This workshop is sponsored by DAPLab partners Intellect Design & Celonis, & is co-organized with the Digital Future Initiative at Columbia Business School, Columbia Engineering, & the Data Science Institute.

events.name: CTV Connect
events.description: Join respected media brands-AdExchanger, Cynopsis, AdMonsters, & Chief Marketer-for a two-day event in New York City, bringing together over 500 decision-makers from across the entire Connected TV ecosystem. Dive into essential topics like measurement, audience engagement, artificial intelligence, budgeting strategies, transparency, & more as we work together to accelerate the growth of CTV. WHO ATTENDSCTV Connect brings together 500+ senior leaders from agencies, brands, publishers, networks, streaming companies, tech platforms, DSPs, SSPs, & measurement providers - all the key players on both the buy & sell sides, including: KEY THEMES TRANSPARENCY  Learn how new standards are driving transparency & building stronger relationships across the ecosystem.  DATA  Learn how TV-specific data can guide targeting, measurement & improve audience engagement.  TARGETING  Hear about advanced targeting techniques that enable more granular, bespoke messaging.  MEASUREMENT  Learn how to capture true ROI & assess campaign impact across channels.  STREAMING  Discover how streaming shapes modern media consumption & opens up new advertising avenues.  SPORTS  Explore the unique ad opportunities & real-time engagement sports bring to CTV.  SHOPPABLE  Discover how CTV is empowering viewers to shop directly from their screens, enhancing both engagement.  ATTENTION/AD EXPERIENCE  Delve into how CTV optimizes the ad experience to maximize viewer engagement & make ads memorable.  OUTCOMES  Explore measurement tools & strategies to ensure your CTV campaigns deliver real results & achieve brand objectives.  CONSUMER PRIVACY  Discuss strategies that ensure compliance while maintaining personalized, effective advertising.

events.description: Calling All Pre-Seed Enterprise, SaaS, & Infra Founders in NYCStruggling to get your early go-to-market & sales in motion? We've got you. Join us in NYC for a packed half-day summit designed to arm you with the exact sales & marketing playbooks you need to land customers & scale fast.  Sales That Close DealsCut through the noise & turn outreach into revenue. This session will break down: Outbound messages that get replies Discovery call questions that uncover real pain points Sales deck secrets that get enterprise buyers to lean in  Led by Work-Bench sales advisor Kiran Narsu, a 25-year sales veteran who's helped startups & global tech giants alike close game-changing deals.  Marketing That Builds DemandHow do you get to prospects with limited brand awareness & budget? events.name: -1 To Bilt Rewards
events.description: 5pm: Doors Open 5:30-6:30pm: Fireside Chat with Ankur Jain Ankur Jain is the Founder & CEO of Bilt Rewards- the nation's largest residential payments & neighborhood loyalty program. The program is the first of its kind to allow renters to earn points on rent payments & rewards on spend at local neighborhood businesses-all while helping build a path to homeownership. Bilt was developed in partnership with an alliance of the nation's largest real estate owners & operators, representing over 4.5 million homes across the United States. Jain is also the Founder of Kairos, a venture studio building companies to tackle the world's greatest challenges. Over the years, Kairos has helped launch & grow over $6.5 billion worth of companies tackling problems in healthcare, housing costs, transportation networks, & more. Before rejoining Kairos in May 2017, Jain was the Head of Product at Tinder, the world's largest social network for meeting people. He joined Tinder after it acquired his previous company, Humin, where he served as Founder & CEO. Jain currently serves on the innovation board of the X-Prize Foundation, & graduated from the Wharton School of Business in May 2011.  -1 to Now is a recurring speaker series at South Park Commons exploring how the world's best builders & thinkers took their ideas from -1 to 0 & beyond. Join us for the inside stories of their experiments, pivots, & breakthroughs on the way to where they are today. Registration & approval is required & space is limited, so please RSVP soon.

events.name: Machine Learning, Physics & Order - Understanding Gen AI
events.description: The subject of the last Meetup was applying Machine Learning to mtDNA, & in this event, I'll show you how to apply Machine Learning to a wider set of problems in the sciences, including physics, & reconstructing order, when no time information is available. Though the subject is very different from mtDNA, the ideas are relatively similar, in that Machine Learning is much more than prediction, & is instead a fundamental tool of the scientific method. This will allow us to understand how people are creating "generative A.I." videos & images, but we'll be taking a rigorous, mathematical approach, to what is a very serious topic, rather than trying to generate memes. In fact, we'll prove mathematically that a Turing Machine (i.e., a computer), cannot generate information, & can only manipulate a constant amount of information, or destroy information, forcing the question of whether generative A.I. is by definition infringement. I'll also discuss actual Artificial Intelligence, specifically, optimization, & how this differs from Machine Learning. I'll introduce a generalized optimization algorithm I developed that can balance weights, sort a list, or interpolate a polynomial, all without any specialization, suggesting the possibility of universally intelligent machines. Slides will be coming soon, for now see Section 2.4 of my paper, "Vectorized Machine Learning" for the core physics ML algorithms.

The subject of the last Meetup was applying Machine Learning to mtDNA, & in this event, I'll show you how to apply Machine Learning to a wider set of problems in the sciences, including physics, & reconstructing order, when no time information is available. Though the subject is very different from mtDNA, the ideas are relatively similar, in that Machine Learning is much more than prediction, & is instead a fundamental tool of the scientific method. This will allow us to understand how people are creating "generative A.I." videos & images, but we'll be taking a rigorous, mathematical approach, to what is a very serious topic, rather than trying to generate memes. In fact, we'll prove mathematically that a Turing Machine (i.e., a computer), cannot generate information, & can only manipulate a constant amount of information, or destroy information, forcing the question of whether generative A.I. is by definition infringement. I'll also discuss actual Artificial Intelligence, specifically, optimization, & how this differs from Machine Learning. I'll introduce a generalized optimization algorithm I developed that can balance weights, sort a list, or interpolate a polynomial, all without any specialization, suggesting the possibility of universally intelligent machines. Slides will be coming soon, for now see Section 2.4 of my paper, "Vectorized Machine Learning" for the core physics ML algorithms.

events.name: Science & Society - AI & Us
events.description: Join us for a very special conversation with two of the world's leading voices on AI: Professor Ruha Benjamin & Professor Kate Crawford. Benjamin is a sociologist & scholar of race, technology, & justice, while Crawford is an AI researcher & expert on the social & political impacts of artificial intelligence. Hosted by our Director of Publishing Joshua Jelly-Schapiro, they will discuss the growing prevalence of AI, & its impact, for the next session of Science & Society. In an age of rampant techno-optimism (and growing techno-anxiety), AI is playing an ever-more central role in how we live, work, think & play: in the conduct of government, in the futures we imagine for ourselves & our species. How should we understand the biases baked into large language models, & other large data sets? How can we best demystify & account for the real & human costs of new technologies & the infrastructures they need? Who controls our data, & governs its use? What potentials exist for using AI, & other technologies, as tools not for bolstering extant iniquities but advancing justice? After the conversation, join us in the garden for stargazing with the Amateur Astronomers Association. Eritrean-Ethiopian food will be available for purchase throughout the evening by Makina Cafe. Please note that seating is limited & will be available on a first-come, first-serve basis. About the speakers Ruha Benjamin is a distinguished sociologist & transdisciplinary scholar at the intersections of science, technology, medicine, & society, with a particular focus on how innovation can perpetuate or mitigate social inequities. She holds the position of Alexander Stewart 1886 Professor of African American Studies at Princeton University & is the founding director of the Ida B. Wells Just Data Lab, an initiative that seeks to harness data as a tool for justice. Her postdoctoral work includes fellowships at UCLA's Institute for Society & Genetics & Harvard University's Science, Technology, & Society Program. Throughout her career, Benjamin has authored several impactful books that explore the complex relationships between race, technology, & justice, including People's Science: Bodies & Rights on the Stem Cell Frontier (2013), Race After Technology: Abolitionist Tools for the New Jim Code (2019), Viral Justice: How We Grow the World We Want (2022), & Imagination: A Manifesto (2024). Benjamin was awarded a MacArthur Fellowship in 2024. Kate Crawford is a research professor at USC Annenberg, a Senior Principal Researcher at Microsoft Research New York, & a leading scholar on the social & political impacts of artificial intelligence. She is the author of Atlas of AI: Power, Politics & the Planetary Costs of Artificial Intelligence (winner of the Sally Hacker Prize), which explores how AI systems are shaped by history, power, & material resources. Crawford is also a co-founder of the Knowing Machines Project, investigating the epistemology of machine learning. Her latest work, Calculating Empires, spans exhibitions in Tokyo, Paris, Barcelona, Gijn, & Prague, examining the intersections of AI, governance, & global infrastructures. Ruha Benjamin & Kate Crawford will be in conversation hosted by Joshua-Jelly Schapiro. Joshua Jelly-Schapiro is a geographer & writer, & he is Director of Publishing at Pioneer Works & the Executive Editor of Pioneer Works Broadcast. His books include Names of New York: Discovering the City's Past, Present, & Future Through Its Place-Names & Island People: The Caribbean & the World. The Science & Society series grapples with our relationships with nature & each other. Each leads us deep into humanity's timely & intersectional challenges, from biodiversity, to plastics, public knowledge, the high seas, farming, climate, & love. The series is supported by the Simons Foundation, & the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation Program in Public Understanding of Science & Technology, bridging the two cultures of science & the arts.

events.description: As we start fresh in 2025, take a moment to celebrate your entrepreneurial journey with us in East Village! events.name: Code & Content - Tech & Media Mixer
events.description: The collaboration the tech & media girls have been waiting for! Join Baddies in Tech & Black Girls in Media for an unforgettable Women's History Month celebration, in partnership with Dotdash Meredith, the media-tech company behind iconic media brands such as People Magazine, Entertainment Weekly, Byrdie, InStyle & more, & Morning Brew, the media company that delivers quick & insightful updates about the business world every day of the week from Wall St. to Silicon Valley! Get ready to connect with NYC's tech & media industry IT girls (just like you!) over light bites & drinks, & be inspired by a powerhouse panel of women of color from Dotdash Meredith & Morning Brew Inc who are leading the charge in their respective fields! Event Highlights Networking Hour: Enjoy light bites & refreshments while participating in AI-powered networking to connect with like-minded peers & potential mentors. Panel Discussion: Hear from a powerhouse panel of women of color leaders from Dotdash Meredith & Morning Brew Inc as they share their journeys, insights, & strategies for success in navigating the industry & thriving as an underrepresented leader. Recruiting x Networking Roundtables: Explore career possibilities with dedicated career stations where you can connect & chat with Dotdash Meredith & Morning Brew Inc recruiters & employees about your specific career interests. events.name: [Book Talk] Stream Big
events.description: Join us at the NYU Game Center for a talk & Q&A with Nathan Grayson in discussion about his new book Stream Big: The Triumphs & Turmoils of Twitch & the Stars Behind the Screen About the book: Told through the diverse & fascinating careers of nine streamers, this is the definitive story of Twitch & how the livestream platform revolutionized technology, entertainment, business, & pop culture. With 2.5 million viewers at any given moment, the streaming platform Twitch is in the lead & often well beyond mainstream networks like CNN & Fox during primetime. On Twitch, the Amazon-owned tech behemoth, the biggest personalities, like Kai Cenat, Flix xQc Lengyel, & Hasan HasanAbi Piker, can earn millions per year by firing up their internet connection & going live. Veteran technology & gaming journalist Nathan Grayson takes us inside the triumphs & tribulations of Twitch with exclusive access to its biggest content creators who helped make the platform into a billion-dollar global business. From Twitch's early days of rapid growth to acquisition by Amazon to the defection of creators & rival platforms, Grayson makes the radical argument that many social technology companies are far more dependent on their creators than the creators are on their platforms. Rivetingly told through nine exceptional Twitch creators whose on-screen personalities helped the company grow into a powerhouse, this is the explosive story of when entertainment meets the internet in the era of social & video content domination.

events.name: Urban Science Research Seminar
events.description: Daniel O'Brien is a professor of public policy & urban affairs & criminology & criminal justice at Northeastern University. The Center for Urban Science + Progress (CUSP) & the Department of Technology Management & Innovation (TMI) at NYU Tandon welcome you to attend a lecture by Daniel O'Brien, professor of public policy & urban affairs & criminology & criminal justice at Northeastern University, as part of the Spring 2025 Urban Science Research Seminar Series. This event will take place in Room 233 (Co-Lab).  About the SpeakerDr. Daniel T. O'Brien is a leader of the burgeoning field of urban informatics, which uses modern digital data to better understand & serve local communities. He is a Professor in the School of Public Policy & Urban Affairs & the School of Criminology & Criminal Justice at Northeastern University & Director of the Boston Area Research Initiative (BARI), an interuniversity center that is an international model for advancing place-based, civically-engaged research that leverages data to benefit local communities. Dr. O'Brien researches the physical & social conditions of neighborhoods & the citywide systems that serve them, often emphasizing questions of equity. This mission has allowed him to study many different subjects, including crime, education, transportation, climate resilience, public health, & public infrastructure, resulting in 50+ peer-reviewed publications & coverage from multiple media outlets, including Wired, The Boston Globe, & National Public Radio. He has raised $9M for his work, including grants from the National Science Foundation, MacArthur Foundation, & others. His book The Urban Commons(Harvard University Press; 2018) won the American Political Science Association's Dennis Judd Best Book Award for work on urban & local politics. Dr. O'Brien has designed programs for educating & supporting others in the practice of urban informatics. BARI's annual conference convenes researchers, public officials, community-based organizations, & others engaged in data-driven research & practice in greater Boston. BARI's Boston Data Portal makes research-ready data describing the people & places of Boston accessible to multiple levels of data literacy, from data scientists to everyday residents. BARI also offers public urban informatics education for community-based organizations & high school students. His textbook, Urban Informatics (Chapman Hall / CRC Press; 2022), which is based on curricula he developed for Northeastern University's Masters of Science in Urban Informatics, is freely available online.  Visitor InformationThis event will take place in Room 233 (Co-Lab) at 370 Jay St. Please visit the NYU Tandon website for directions & a campus map. Advance registration through Eventbrite is required for campus access at NYU for external guests.  About the Urban Science Research Seminar SeriesThe Center for Urban Science + Progress's annual Research Seminar series features leading voices in the growing field of urban informatics examining real-world challenges facing cities & urban environments around the world. The Fall 2024 series is organized by Assistant Professors Takahiro Yabe, Qi Sun, & Graham Dove. Additional speakers for the Spring 2025 Urban Science Research Seminar series include Greg Morrisett (Cornell Tech), Sybil Derrible (University of Illinois Chicago), & Ning Lin (Princeton).

events.name: OWIH Accelerator Happy Hour
events.description: Join us at the Accelerator Program Q&A Happy Hour!This exciting event is designed to connect prospective applicants with the Offshore Wind Innovation Hub team, partners, & our dynamic ecosystem. Whether to ask questions about the 2025 Call for Innovators or get to know the people driving the program, this will be a valuable opportunity to build meaningful connections & gain insights about the OWIH Accelerator! About the OWIH Accelerator Program:Building on a strong two-year track record, this six-month intensive program provides unparalleled support for innovators looking to develop novel technology & advance commercialization in the New York offshore wind market. Selected cohort companies will work closely with Equinor, a global energy company currently developing the 3.3 GW Empire Wind offshore wind farm. The partners will also transform the South Brooklyn Marine Terminal into an offshore wind hub, which will be one of the largest dedicated offshore wind port facilities in the United States. The Offshore Wind Innovation Hub is an initiative, led by Equinor, in collaboration with Urban Future Lab at NYU Tandon School of Engineering, & National Offshore Wind R&D Consortium - supported by New York City Economic Development Corporation. ====== Learn about program benefits, technologies in scope, & how to submit an application on our website.

The partners will also transform the South Brooklyn Marine Terminal into an offshore wind hub, which will be one of the largest dedicated offshore wind port facilities in the United States. The Offshore Wind Innovation Hub is an initiative, led by Equinor, in collaboration with Urban Future Lab at NYU Tandon School of Engineering, & National Offshore Wind R&D Consortium - supported by New York City Economic Development Corporation. ====== Learn about program benefits, technologies in scope, & how to submit an application on our website.

events.name: 3DNY Meetup
events.description: Details## 3DNY - WEDNESDAY MARCH 19, 2025 ## OPEN BAR: SPONSORED BY ADOBE *Well drinks, while supplies last WHAT:3DNY is a Networking community for the Architectural Visualization & Visual Effects industries, with speakers & time to chat, enjoy & have a drink with old & new friends in the industry. We explore related topics in animation, VR/AR/XR, AI, game design, metaverse technologies, traditional architecture, real estate trends, & excellence in interior design. We look forward to seeing you again - or to having you join us! We meet the 3rd Wednesday of every other month :) WHERE:Lucky Jack's129 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002Downstairs, basement bar WHEN:Wednesday, March 19, 20257 pm - 9 pm, or later WHO: SELENA LOUNDS & ANNA VIOLETTESenior 3D Solutions Consultants: Adobe Join Selena & Anna for a deep dive into materials in Adobe Substance 3D. They will showcase Adobe's latest showreels & highlight the power of unmetered assets, demonstrating how Substance 3D enables designers to create high-quality, scalable materials for any pipeline. https://www.linkedin.com/in/annaviolette/ *** JAMES FALCONERChief Client Officer: The BoundaryImmersive Storytelling for Unbuilt Spaces The Boundary is a world leader in photorealistic creative visualization, executing immersive content for some of the world's most extraordinary places. James will reveal how virtual production is redefining storytelling in real estate, allowing live talent to perform "within" architectural spaces before they exist. He will showcase how The Boundary has utilized these Hollywood-grade techniques in recent work in the luxury branded residence sector at projects such as Mandarin Oriental Residences & Mercedes-Benz Places, Miami. https://www.linkedin.com/company/the-boundary-london/https://www.the-boundary.com/us/https://www.realspace.io/ *** RICHARD BROADBRIDGECEO & Founder: 4D ViewsCreating Engaging Stories with Volumetric Video Presentation Description : 4Dviews will present how hyper-realistic actor & performer assets have been used in a variety of high-profile storytelling events in a variety of 3D & 2D mediums & contexts. Richard Broadbridge is the CEO of 4DViews, the most successful volumetric capture company in the market today. "Volumetric capture allows us to build digital experiences firmly centered on human stories. By building interactive experiences around people we care about, digital storytelling has begun to undergo a truly profound revolution. At 4DViews we've built a complete tool set that will allow you to Capture, Build & Deliver engaging multi-branch interactive content ready to be used in any medium. A French & American citizen Richard has now spent more than seventeen years bringing 4DViews' technology to XR, audio-visual & research clients in North America, the UK, the EU & East Asia. He is a graduate of New York University & the Haute Ecole de Commerce in Paris. Richard resides in the French Alps where the 4DViews team balances week-long volumetric capture innovation with weekend recreation in a rugged Alpen environment. https://www.linkedin.com/company/4dviews

events.name: Book Talk - The Experimentation Machine
events.description: Join us for an exclusive fireside chat with Jeff Bussgang, General Partner at Flybridge Capital & professor at Harvard Business School, as he discusses his new book, The Experimentation Machine: Finding Product-Market Fit in the Age of AI.nA seasoned venture capitalist, entrepreneur, & author, Bussgang explores how startups leverage structured experimentation to drive breakthrough innovation. Whether you're a founder, investor or operator, this conversation will provide invaluable insights into building a culture of rapid learning & iteration, empowered by AI tools.nThis event will include an interview & open Q&A, followed by a book signing & reception with light food & drinks, offering a great chance to meet the author as well as connect with fellow entrepreneurs, investors & startup leaders.n All attendees will receive a free copy of Jeffs book & have an opportunity to get it signed during the reception.nnBrought to you by Lynx CollectivenLynx Collective empowers & advances the NYC startup ecosystem. We foster connections through our programming & events & share insights via our weekly newsletter.nLynx Collective was founded by two 20-year veterans of the NYC startup ecosystem: Andrew Chang (investor, advisor, board member) & Dorothy Chang (investor at NextWave NYC & Flybridge).nAbout our Sponsors (Perkins Coie & Rho)nPerkins Coie is a leading international law firm that is known for providing high value, strategic solutions & extraordinary client service on matters vital to our clients' success. With more than 1,200 attorneys in offices across the United States, Europe, & Asia, we provide a full array of corporate, commercial litigation, intellectual property, & regulatory legal advice to a broad range of clients, including many of the world's most innovative companies & industry leaders as well as public & not-for-profit organizations.nnFrom two-person startups to public companies,    Rho is the banking platform with everything businesses need to manage cash, control spend, & automate finance busywork. Rho offers corporate cards, banking, treasury, expense management, AP, accounting automation, & more in one integrated platform backed by award-winning support.nRho is a fintech company, not a bank. events.name: Data Science Salon - Applying AI & ML To Finance & Tech
events.description: Join us at Data Science Salon New York for an exclusive experience designed to connect you with the people you'd like to meet, without any surprises. Data Science Salon New York is an annual one-day conference, limited to vetted attendees, focused on using artificial intelligence & machine learning in the enterprise. This intimate event, a mix of TedEx, Foo Camp & Summit, curates data science sessions to bring senior managers, C-suite executives, & the most talented local AI/ML researchers face-to-face, fostering education & collaboration on innovative solutions in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive analytics, & best practices. Expect to walk away with actionable insights from those working on the frontlines of machine learning in the enterprise. Please note, all session footage will only be available to those who attend the event in person. About DSS New YorkData Science Salon New York is a one-day, invite-only experience for senior managers, C-suite executives, & top local AI/ML researchers. This exclusive event is all about networking & connecting you with the right people you want to meet. It features a curated mix of use-cases, technical talks, workshops, & Q&A sessions, designed to foster direct interaction & collaboration among industry leaders. Apply to attend & join us to gain actionable insights from those at the forefront of machine learning in the enterprise.
